name: Projectportfolio
tagline: This is a list of a few projects I have completed over the course of my undergraduate studies
body:
### Operating System Dispatcher ( Implemented in Java)
This is an simulation of an operating system dispatcher that I implemented in Java and took around 800 lines of code. It has a very simple GUI interface that allows the user to simulate the movement of operating system tasks between the ready queue and the CPU. Here is a link to the applet, and here is a link to the source code. 

### Android Applications (Creating using MIT APP inventor)
I created a few basic applications using the MIT app inventor. Feel free to download and try the apps yourself. Here is a link to a few applications I've made.

### C++ Data Structure Sample ( "Cousins" Counter)
For a data structures and algorithms course I developed a program that would count the number of "cousins" of a particularly specified node in a tree data structure. The program took over 200 lines of code and was implemented in C++. Here is the link to the source code which shows my proficiency in working with C++.
